entry.title: The Local Better Regulation Office (Dissolution and Transfer of Functions, Etc.) Order 2012

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The Local Better Regulation Office (Dissolution and Transfer of Functions, Etc.) Order 2012

entry.summary: This Order, made under section 18 of the Regulatory Enforcement and Sanctions Act 2008 (c.13) (“RESA”), provides for the dissolution of the Local Better Regulation Office (“LBRO”) and the transfer of its functions to the Secretary of State and the Welsh Ministers.

title.div: The Smoke Control Areas (Exempted Fireplaces) (Wales) Order 2012 / Gorchymyn Ardaloedd Rheoli Mwg (Lleoedd Tân Esempt) (Cymru) 2012

div.p: This Order revokes and replaces with amendments the Smoke Control Areas (Exempted Fireplaces) (Wales) Order 2011 (S.I. 2011/38) (W.13).
Mae'r Gorchymyn hwn yn dirymu ac yn disodli gyda diwygiadau Orchymyn Ardaloedd Rheoli Mwg (Lleoedd Tân Esempt) (Cymru) 2011 (O.S. 2011/38) (Cy.13).

entry.title: The Compromise Agreements (Automatic Enrolment) (Description of Person) Order 2012
entry.summary: This Order specifies that, for the purposes of section 58(5)(c) of the Pensions Act 2008 (c.30), a legal executive is a “relevant independent adviser” for the purposes of being able to give advice in relation to compromise agreements under that Act.

entry.title: The Spring Traps Approval Order (Northern Ireland) 2012
entry.summary: This Order revokes and replaces the Spring Traps Approval Order (Northern Ireland) 1996.

entry.title: The Automatic Enrolment (Miscellaneous Amendments) Regulations 2012
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Employers’ Duties (Implementation) Regulations 2010 (S.I. 2010/4), the Employers’ Duties (Registration and Compliance) Regulations 2010 (S.I. 2010/5) and the Occupational and Personal Pension Schemes (Automatic Enrolment) Regulations 2010 (S.I. 2010/772).

entry.title: Licensing and Registration of Clubs (Amendment) (2011 Act) (Commencement No.2) Order (Northern Ireland) 2012
entry.summary: This Order provides for the coming into operation of the provisions of the Licensing and Registration of Clubs (Amendment) Act (Northern Ireland) 2011 listed in the Schedule to this Order, on 1st May 2012.

entry.title: The Licensing (Form of Licence) (Amendment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2012
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Licensing (Form of Licence) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 1997 as courts may no longer make an order disqualifying additional permitted hours or an extension licence, granted to certain premises, as an alternative to suspending the intoxicating liquor licence.

entry.title: The Registration of Clubs (Notice relating to Age) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2012
entry.summary: These Regulations prescribe the notice relating to age that registered clubs must display in those areas of club premises where intoxicating liquor is supplied; the information to be contained in the notice in relation to offences concerning the supply to, obtaining or consumption of intoxicating liquor by persons under 18 years of age; and the list of acceptable proof-of-age documents where there is doubt as to whether a person is aged 18 years or over.

title.div: The Welsh Language (Wales) Measure 2011 (Commencement No.3) Order 2012 / Gorchymyn Mesur y Gymraeg (Cymru) 2011 (Cychwyn Rhif 3) 2012

div.p: This Order is made under section 156(2) of the Welsh Language (Wales) Measure 2011 (“the Measure”) and brings into force certain provisions of the Measure. These provisions relate to the Welsh Ministers' Welsh language strategy and the establishment of the Welsh Language Partnership Council.

Mae'r Gorchymyn hwn wedi ei wneud o dan adran 156(2) o Fesur y Gymraeg (Cymru) 2011 (“y Mesur”) ac mae'n dwyn i rym ddarpariaethau penodol yn y Mesur. Mae'r darpariaethau hyn yn ymwneud â strategaeth iaith Gymraeg Gweinidogion Cymru a sefydlu Cyngor Partneriaeth y Gymraeg.

entry.title: The Licensing (Notice relating to Age) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2012
entry.summary: These Regulations prescribe the notice relating to age that licensed premises must display in those areas where intoxicating liquor is sold; the information to be contained in the notice in relation to offences concerning the sale to, purchase or consumption of intoxicating liquor by persons under 18 years of age; and the list of acceptable proof-of-age documents where there is doubt as to whether a person is aged 18 years or over.

entry.title: The Registration of Clubs (Certificate of Registration) (Amendment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2012
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Registration of Clubs (Certificate of Registration) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 1997 by inserting a reference to Article 44(2) of the Registration of Clubs (Northern Ireland) Order 1996, which provides for the endorsement of penalty points, on a certification of registration issued to clubs by the courts.

entry.title: The Licensing (Register of Licences) (Amendment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2012
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Licensing (Register of Licences) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 1997 so that particulars of any conviction for any offence under the Licensing (Northern Ireland) Order 1996, and of any penalty points endorsed on a licence or any suspension order and the result of any appeal are recorded in the register of licences.

title.div: The Integrated Family Support Teams (Composition of Teams and Board Functions) (Wales) Regulations 2012 / Rheoliadau Timau Integredig Cymorth i Deuluoedd (Cyfansoddiad Timau a Swyddogaethau Byrddau) (Cymru) 2012

div.p: These Regulations make requirements about the professional categories from which the workers who are members of an integrated family support (“IFS”) team must be drawn. These Regulations also set out what an IFS board must do to meet the objectives conferred on it by section 62 of the Children and Families (Wales) Measure 2010 (“the 2010 Measure”).

Mae'r Rheoliadau hyn yn gwneud gofynion ynglŷn â'r categorïau proffesiynol y mae'n rhaid dewis gweithwyr ohonynt i fod yn aelodau o dîm integredig cymorth i deuluoedd (“ICiD”). Mae'r Rheoliadau hyn hefyd yn pennu'r hyn y mae'n rhaid i fwrdd ICiD ei wneud i gyrraedd yr amcanion a roddwyd iddo gan adran 62 o Fesur Plant a Theuluoedd (Cymru) 2010 (“Mesur 2010”).

title.div: The Integrated Family Support Teams (Family Support Functions) (Wales) Regulations 2012 / Rheoliadau Timau Integredig Cymorth i Deuluoedd (Swyddogaethau Cymorth i Deuluoedd) (Cymru) 2012

div.p: These Regulations set out the functions of a local authority and the functions of a Local Health Board that are “family support functions” for the purposes of section 58 of the Children and Families (Wales) Measure 2010 (“the 2010 Measure”). Section 57 of the 2010 Measure requires local authorities to establish one or more integrated family support (“IFS”) teams in their area and requires a Local Health Board to participate in their establishment. The IFS teams are not separate legal entities but bring together the local authority and the Local Health Board to perform together certain health and social care functions to address the issues of the families whose cases can be referred to it.

Mae'r Rheoliadau hyn yn nodi pa rai o swyddogaethau awdurdod lleol a swyddogaethau Bwrdd Iechyd Lleol sy'n “swyddogaethau cymorth i deuluoedd” at ddibenion adran 58 o Fesur Plant a Theuluoedd (Cymru) (“Mesur 2010”). Mae adran 57 o Fesur 2010 yn gwneud yn ofynnol bod awdurdodau lleol yn sefydlu un neu ragor o dimau integredig cymorth i deuluoedd (“ICiD”) yn eu hardal ac yn gwneud yn ofynnol bod Bwrdd Iechyd Lleol yn cymryd rhan yn eu sefydlu. Nid yw'r timau ICiD yn endidau cyfreithiol ar wahân, ond maent yn dwyn yr awdurdod lleol a'r Bwrdd Iechyd Lleol at ei gilydd i gyflawni rhai swyddogaethau iechyd a gofal cymdeithasol, er mwyn rhoi sylw i faterion teuluoedd y ceir atgyfeirio'u hachosion atynt.

entry.title: The School Admissions Code and School Admission Appeals Code (Appointed Day) Order 2012

category.term: Special educational needs and additional support

entry.summary: This Order appoints 1st February 2012 as the day on which the School Admissions Code (“the Admissions Code”) and the School Admission Appeals Code (“the Appeals Code”) (“the Codes”) come into force.

entry.title: The Transport Levying Bodies (Amendment) Regulations 2012
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Transport Levying Regulations 1992 (“the Principal Regulations”) so as to apply them expressly to integrated transport authorities and to the Greater Manchester Combined Authority.

title.div: The Integrated Family Support Teams (Review of Cases) (Wales) Regulations 2012 / Rheoliadau Timau Integredig Cymorth i Deuluoedd (Adolygu Achosion) (Cymru) 2012

div.p: These Regulations establish requirements about how local authorities must review the cases of the families who are supported by Integrated Family Support (“IFS”) teams. The requirements for a local authority to review a case do not apply in relation to a child whose case is already subject to review under the Review of Children’s Cases (Wales) Regulations 2007 (S.I. 2007/307 (W.26)) (“the Review Regulations”) by virtue of being “looked after” as defined in section 22(1) of the Children Act 1989.

Mae'r Rheoliadau hyn yn sefydlu gofynion am sut y mae'n rhaid i awdurdodau lleol adolygu achosion teuluoedd sy'n cael eu cefnogi gan dimau integredig cymorth i deuluoedd (“ICiD”). Nid yw'r gofynion i awdurdod lleol adolygu achos yn gymwys o ran plentyn y mae ei achos eisoes yn ddarostyngedig i adolygiad o dan Reoliadau Adolygu Achosion Plant (Cymru) 2007 (O.S. 2007/307 (Cy.26)) (“y Rheoliadau Adolygu”) yn rhinwedd eu bod “yn derbyn gofal” yn unol â'r diffiniad o “looked after” yn adran 22(1) o Ddeddf Plant 1989.

entry.title: The Special Educational Needs (Direct Payments) (Pilot Scheme) Order 2012

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The Special Educational Needs (Direct Payments) (Pilot Scheme) Order 2011

category.term: Special educational needs and additional support

entry.summary: This Order makes provision for a pilot scheme in accordance with which local authorities may make direct payments under section 532A(1) of the Education Act 1996 (“the 1996 Act”).

entry.title: The Wildlife and Natural Environment (2011 Act) (Commencement No.3) Order (Northern Ireland) 2012
entry.summary: This Order commences provisions of the Wildlife and Natural Environment Act (Northern Ireland) 2011 (“the Act”).

title.div: The Planning Permission (Withdrawal of Development Order or Local Development Order) (Compensation) (Wales) Order 2012 / Gorchymyn Caniatâd Cynllunio (Tynnu'n ôl Orchymyn Datblygu neu Orchymyn Datblygu Lleol) (Iawndal) (Cymru) 2012

div.p: Section 107 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (“the Act”) provides for compensation to be payable where planning permission granted by a local planning authority is subsequently revoked or modified. Section 108 of the Act extends this entitlement to compensation to circumstances where planning permission granted by a development order or a local development order is withdrawn.

Mae adran 107 o Ddeddf Cynllunio Gwlad a Thref 1990 (“y Ddeddf”) yn darparu bod iawndal yn daladwy pan fo caniatâd cynllunio a roddwyd gan awdurdod cynllunio lleol yn cael ei ddirymu neu ei addasu ar ôl hynny. Mae adran 108 o'r Ddeddf yn estyn yr hawl hon i gael iawndal i amgylchiadau pan fo caniatâd cynllunio a roddwyd drwy orchymyn datblygu neu orchymyn datblygu lleol yn cael ei dynnu'n ôl.
